meanings.definition: A network of fine lines or wires in the focus of the eyepiece of an optical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The scientist adjusted the graticule to focus the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The graticule in the telescope helped in precise measurements.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student pretended the graticule was a spider web in the microscope.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a tangled graticule, crisscrossing with uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The intricate graticule resembled a spider's delicate web under the lens.

meanings.definition: A network of lines representing meridians and parallels, on which a map or plan can be represented.
meanings.sent1: The mapmaker carefully drew the graticule on the map for accurate navigation.
meanings.sent2: The graticule on the globe helped in understanding global coordinates.
meanings.sent3: The children imagined the graticule on the map as a giant maze to explore.
meanings.sent4: The graticule of the map mirrored the intricate pathways of life.
meanings.sent5: The graticule on the map was like a roadmap guiding travelers through unknown territories.
